activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Charles Puckett

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Violation Report

Activity: Bail/bond hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:24 AM Defendant Jonathan Charles Puckett appeared by video.  Attorney Kevin M Smith appeared by attorney Walter Isaacson by video for Jonathan Charles Puckett.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant brought proof to Clerk of Courts Office of bond he posted. Court remands case to branch 6 for scheduling.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Violation Report
Bail/bond hearing on September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.A.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  No Weapons, Absolute sobriety, Curfew 6 pm to 6 am, GPS required not to be withing 500 feet of T.A.S.'s residence. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. DEFENDANT TO POST THE ADDITIONAL $100 BY THE END OF DAY ON AUGUST 29, 2022 AT THE ROCK COUNTY SHERIFFS OFFICE

3:16 PM Defendant Jonathan Charles Puckett appeared by video.  Attorney Kevin M Smith appeared by video for Jonathan Charles Puckett.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. State argues for bond increase, Defense objects with argument. Court orders an additional $100 Cash bond. Defendant must post or turn self in to the Sherriff's Department by end of day August 29, 2022.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report

records.addlTxt: 03:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonathan Charles Puckett appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Jonathan Charles Puckett. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $500 Cash Bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.A.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No Weapons. Absolute sobriety, Curfew 6 pm to 6 am, GPS required not to be within 500 feet of T.A.S.'s residence. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendants attorney enters not guilty plea and matter to be set.
